direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods add text nodes to the element but at different positions (end vs. start).
Both methods add content to the element, but append() adds HTML while appendText() adds plain text.
Both methods add content to the element, but prepend() adds HTML while prependText() adds plain text.
Both methods set text content, but text() replaces existing content while appendText() adds to it.
Both methods set content, but html() replaces existing content with HTML while appendText() adds plain text.
Both methods add a node to the element, but appendChild() is more general and can add any type of node.
Both methods add a node to the element, but prependChild() adds the node at the start.
Both methods insert nodes into the element, but insertChildren() allows specifying the position.
Both methods modify the element's content, but empty() removes all child nodes while appendText() adds a text node.
